resources.string: Vitamin D3 can be derived from an animal source (such as sheepâ€™s wool) or lichen (a vegan-friendly source).
Despite its name, eggplants do not actually contain eggs. They thank their name due to their shape. Did you know that the eggplant is actually a fruit and not a vegetable?
Most lactic acid is vegan, as it primarily occurs during the natural fermentation process of plants or is man-made using plants.
Cacao butter is the fat contained in cocoa beans.
Angora wool is a soft fibre that comes from the domestic Angora rabbit. Soft, warm sweaters are made from this material.
Casein is an animal protein that is exclusively found in mammalian milk.
Cashmere is a soft fibre. It is not vegan since it is usually made from goat hair.
Keratin is often added to hair products. It is an animal protein that comes from the hair, skin, horns, feathers, beaks, hooves and claws of animals. Therefore, the majority of keratin is not vegan.
Lard is the white fat that is obtained from the fatty tissue of a pig.

Latex may contain the milk protein casein. Examples of such latex products are condoms, gloves and balloons. However, the amount of casein in any latex product is very small. Therefore, many vegans still use latex products.
Monoglycerides can be sourced from animal fat. They are vegan if they come from vegetable oils.
Diglycerides can be sourced from animal fat. They are vegan if they come from vegetable oils.
Musk is often added to parfums, and shaving and care products. This ingredient comes from a gland of the musk deer that lives in the Himlayas and Tibet.

Pearls are created by oysters. Most pearls are cultured. This means that an irritant is implanted into the oyster shell. Subsequently, the oysters coates the irritant with the crystalline substance nacre and the pearl is harvested. Many oysters die during this process.
Shellac is exploited from the lac bug, which is an insect. It can be found in many different prducts and is used as a glazing agent.
Tallow is rendered beef or sheep fat. It is often added to soaps.
Wool is a textile fibre that is obtained from the fleece, hide or fur from animals.These animals may include sheep, goats, alpacas and more.
Butterfat is the fat in dairy. It is the natural constituent of cows\' milk and it is used to make butter.
